What is Django?

Django is a high-level Python Web framework that encourages rapid development and clean, pragmatic design. It is an open-source and free web application framework, written in Python and maintained by the Django Software Foundation (DSF). Django follows the model-view-controller architectural model and focuses on reusability, rapid development, and automating as much as possible. Created in 2003, it was designed to ease the creation of complex, database-driven websites by making common web development tasks fast and easy.

The Django Framework

Object-Relational Mapper Use Python to define your data models. A dynamic database-access API is yours for free.
Automatic Admin Interface Django creates production-ready interfaces for people to add and update content automatically.
Elegant URL Design There are no framework-specific limitations, so you can design good-looking and flexible cruft-free URLs.
Template System Django provides an extensibe and designer-friendly template language to separate content, design, and Python code.
Cache System Get into memcached or other cache frameworks for greater performance.
Internationalization Django provides support for multi-language applications, allowing the user to specify translation strings and providing hooks for language-specific functionality.

Installation

  1. Install Python
    • Download Python at python.org. If you are running Linux or Mac OS X, it is most likely already installed.
    • You can verify that Python is installed by typing "python" from your shell. You should see a message like this:
      • Python 2.6.6 (r266:84292, Dec 26 2010, 22:31:48)
[GCC 4.4.5] on linux2
Type "help", "copyright", "credits" or "license" for more information.
>>>
  2. Remove old versions of Django
  3. Install Django
    • There are three doable options to install Django:
      1. Install a version of Django provided by your OS distribution.
      2. Install an official release.
      3. Install the latest development version.
    • You can verify that Django is connected to Python by typing "python" from your shell, then trying to import Django:
      • >>> import django
>>> print(django.get_version())
1.6
  4. You're Done!

Django Fun Facts

  • Popular sites that use Django include Pinterest, Instagram, Mozilla, The Washington Times, and the Public Broadcasting Service
  • Django was created by Adrian Holovaty and Simon Willison, web programmers at the Lawrence Journal-World newspaper.
  • Because the Holovaty and Willison were constantly in a fast-moving online-news environment, Django was created to handle the difficulties that come with intensive newsroom-deadlines in order to meet the stringent requirements of the men who wrote it.
  • Django is named after guitarist Django Reinhardt.
